children.tweet: RT @Amermalik12: It just goes to show no matter how good your intentions ..you just can't win with the soap opera that is Pakistan cricket.
@Amermalik12 no surprise when politicians like Moin are given important positions in the board. shooting ourselves in the foot.
@Amermalik12 he's on one mission and that is to have #Misbah removed as captain. can't see Moin letting Waqar run the team professionally
@M_Tarar I know what you mean, I'm not comfortable with his support of Kaneria, but most times he's not wrong. He will say it as it is.
@Amermalik12 I used to be a huge fan. but I feel he hasn't been consistent in the positions he has taken over the last few yrs.
RT @M_Tarar: @Amermalik12 couldn't agree more. #Misbah is undoubtedly the best captain we've had since Imran. I used to be a huge fan of Wa…
@Amermalik12 couldn't agree more. #Misbah is undoubtedly the best captain we've had since Imran. I used to be a huge fan of Wasim as captain
RT @M_Tarar: @Amermalik12 but I feel Misbah has surpassed Wasim now. what he has done with so little talent at his disposal is remarkable. …
@Shortpitched @Amermalik12 can't disagree. but it also didn't help that he was removed every 2 years. in a logical world, Wasim was clearly
@Shortpitched @Amermalik12 the only captain this team should've had from mid-90s (at least) to Wasim's retirement. no other player had
@M_Tarar @Amermalik12 I think it was partly Wasim's ambition in 1993 & ineptitude of board members who removed Javed so early & ruined 90s
@Shortpitched @Amermalik12 any business being captain when Wasim was at the height of his powers
@M_Tarar @Amermalik12 I am not questioning Wasim's leadership but that he could have done more. Tho he did make some dodgy decisions
RT @Shortpitched: @Amermalik12 @M_Tarar som1 to guide, not just cricket but thru life teaching them critical thinking& analysis.\nImran did …
@Amermalik12 @M_Tarar som1 to guide, not just cricket but thru life teaching them critical thinking& analysis.\nImran did tht to his charges
@M_Tarar @Shortpitched Pakistan has never been short of captains..the only thing players required and still do is a psychologist.
@Shortpitched @Amermalik12 that might be true.. but they still needed a good leader which Wasim was. the same set of players produced dismal
@Shortpitched @Amermalik12 results under Saeed Anwar, Moin Khan, Amir Sohail and Rashid Latif. surely some credit must go to Wasim then.
@Amermalik12 RazzaqHe never had the game to bat 3 in England.2 years later Waqar took 7fers in consecutive matches.U can't bench Waqar in UK
@Amermalik12 @Shortpitched yeah he was speaking on Indian tv with Waqar during the last odi series in india. very sensible views.
@M_Tarar @Shortpitched it was...oh there's something wrong with my keypad lol
@Amermalik12 @Shortpitched haha. sure so who was the leak according to hearsay?
@M_Tarar @Shortpitched Haha..sources?..what sources..I don't know for certain.just hearsay.
@Amermalik12 @Shortpitched so according to your sources, who leaked the fixers to the media?
@Amermalik12 @M_Tarar knowing our society and how systemic corruption is, I don't believe for a second that PCB ppl didn't get a cut
RT @Shortpitched: @Amermalik12 @M_Tarar I will not be surprised to see Butt opening the batting in 3 years. Price of him keeping it quite
@M_Tarar @Amermalik12 sir we are hooked onto it. We r still gonna watch. I vowed not to watch after 07 & then after 2010. I was at the oval.
@Shortpitched @Amermalik12 that would be disgusting.. if that happens, I will not watch Pak cricket.
@Amermalik12 @M_Tarar I will not be surprised to see Butt opening the batting in 3 years. Price of him keeping it quite

@Amermalik12 @M_Tarar absolutely. Which makes u think of religiosity of ppl like MoYo who should have stood up but keep quiet
@M_Tarar @Shortpitched it was blatantly obvious something dodgy was going on in Sydney
@Shortpitched @Amermalik12 actually let me correct that.. he didn't even TRY to affect the runout. the commentators were shocked.
@M_Tarar @Amermalik12 Fakmal is either incredibly connected or absolutely incompetent. some of his drops in key matches can't b coincidental
@Shortpitched @Amermalik12 I don't rememeber that. but good point. one thing ppl forget is that england no-balls were what these guys were
@Shortpitched @Amermalik12 caught doing as a teaser. clearly they had done much more in the past. shameful characters.
@M_Tarar @Amermalik12 I have never been able to get over Amir's over to Hussey in 2010 S/F. Most ppl remember Ajmal's last but forget Amir's

@M_Tarar @Amermalik12 just as I don't think Gibbs drop in 99 was just another drop knowing what we know now.

@M_Tarar @Shortpitched snap

@Amermalik12 g'night. educational for me too as always. cheers. @Shortpitched
@Shortpitched @M_Tarar my pleasure have a good evening.. Long live Pakistan cricket ..lol
@Amermalik12 @M_Tarar indeed it was an interesting chat. Thank u gents.
@M_Tarar @Shortpitched Gents I'm off to bed..got work early..interesting chat.. Very informative and enjoyable.
@Shortpitched @Amermalik12 if they jailed him, erased all his records.. but you gotta do it with a clean judge in a transparent way.
@Shortpitched @Amermalik12 you can't have a crook for a jduge. no credibility for the process with a crook like Qayyum
@M_Tarar @Amermalik12 but that's the biggest proof. There was so much corruption that even a corrupt judge found em guilty or suspicious
@Amermalik12 @Shortpitched the judge. the judge Qayyum himself was far far dodgier than the players he was investigating! he resigned to
@Amermalik12 @Shortpitched avoid an investigation into his own conduct as a judge! he was caught on tape offering to "fix" trials.
@Shortpitched @Amermalik12 fakhru bhai is a sharif insaan. unless you gave him hard proof, he wasn't going to do anything.
@M_Tarar @Amermalik12 but it was still better than Fakhru's investigation of Malik few years earlier. It basically dismissed the claim
@Amermalik12 @Shortpitched kinda laughable that such a crook was presiding over a case of corruption.
RT @Shortpitched: @Amermalik12 @M_Tarar quite possible. But I am suspicious of all who became Tableeghi soon after that enquiry. Speaks of …
@Shortpitched @Amermalik12 agree. the newfound religiosity only makes them more suspicious
@M_Tarar @Shortpitched one last story ..Me and Saqi were sitting at cafe in Heathrow terminal 4 in 99..
RT @Shortpitched: @M_Tarar @Amermalik12 Saqi was brilliant.Can't forget tour of India in 99.If Moin hasn't missed Sehwag in Multan he would…
@Shortpitched @Amermalik12 that makes me angry to this day. the way Saqi was treating around 2003 and later was a disgrace.
@Shortpitched he did. I've heard that a lot about the doosra. can't say I remember that. I think he needed a bit more support. Wasim used
@Shortpitched him at the death a lot. all captains did. maybe he should've gotten more support. if he's getting beaten up, give him a break
@M_Tarar too much politics. But he was a very good bowler regardless of his idiosyncrasies. That guy is a cult hero in Oz #Rana
@Shortpitched Rana also deserved better. still don't understand why his career ended the way it did. if it was for underperforming under YK
@Shortpitched 60% of the team seemed to do that to get rid of YK. why just pick on Rana? not saying he was a legend but he was pretty decent
@M_Tarar true. Malik, Fakmal,\nMoYo, Afridi all came back except Rana.I guess he stopped giving a fuck about these ppl.Was making money in Oz
@Shortpitched plus when you've invested time in a player, why discard him like that? another player who was perfect for t20.
@M_Tarar completely agree. That about management and communication. Someone should have spoken to him to keep him involved post 03
@Shortpitched yeah exactly.. and yet they kept him out for all those years even after Ws retired. should've been in the mix right after 2003
@M_Tarar he also bowled pretty well in 06 under Inzi. Slightly down on pace but very disciplined & tight with line/length
@M_Tarar I think he broke Athertin or Stewarts fingers in his debut series in 96 in Eng
@Shortpitched I really liked Shahid Nazir too. he bowled really well in that 97 tournament in aus. deserved better.
@Shortpitched aah, right.. it was pretty tough for anyone to become a regular with the Ws around unless you were a Zahid or an Actor
@M_Tarar series Akram was supposed to dominate & cement his place is the one where he has his hand slashed saving Saqi in JoBurg in 97
@Shortpitched no I think the only weird thing was that he didn't run in hard. just seemed to jog in. I remember even Imran picked on him for
@M_Tarar correct. IK started when he remodelled his action to try & go side on. He didn't have jump when he started, he was very front on
@Shortpitched I've never understood the jump thing. I've tried it. seems so artificial. running through the crease seems more natural
@Shortpitched regardless, this was a lot of fun. very enjoyable. always fun to talk to someone who's seen some cricket from the 90s. I lose
@Shortpitched in world cricket, yes. but I think he has caused some irreversible damage to Pak cricket. esp his use of private media to play
@M_Tarar Shahzad certainly idolises him. Uakmal seems to be going that way as well. Sohaib etc lot mature then that
RT @Shortpitched: @M_Tarar this is what gets me with this Tableeghi lot. Pray & preach but keep lying. Backbiting, jealous, politic as much…
@M_Tarar the only1 I haven't heard much from is Saeed. Inzi/MoYo want money, r insecure hence hatred of MYK & Misbah tht they will over take
@Shortpitched lol no kidding. the tableeghi tola inc Inzi, MoYo, Afridi have played so much dirty politics. pretty sad really.
@M_Tarar good night. It was an enjoyable discussion.
@Shortpitched anyway, have a good night sir. am out.
@M_Tarar this is what gets me with this Tableeghi lot. Pray & preach but keep lying. Backbiting, jealous, politic as much as u like
@Shortpitched politics with the team. other problem childs like Fakmal Jr, Shehzad, etc will follow his footsteps.
@M_Tarar in cricketing history Afridi is a foot note. He has played remarkable games but no more. He is a much better bowler than batsman
@Shortpitched my cool when I have to talk to kids who think cricket begins and end with Afridi.
@M_Tarar because of IK we think if u don't have big jump then it isn't a good action but normally jump isn't very good& Akram was like Walsh
@Shortpitched that. but all commentators were surprised when he released the ball because it came at serious pace. decent bowler.
@M_Tarar actually most of our bowlers have weird action but Akram had an incredibly smooth action for a Pak pacer hence looked weird to us
@Shortpitched Akram too had serious pace despite the weird action. I remember him making Tendulkar look like a rookie in a game.
@M_Tarar true. Just think, Zahid, Akram, Shahid Nazir, Aqib, Mohsin Kamal, Fazle Akbar & we stuck with Ata as our key bowler. No one post Ws
@Shortpitched agree. very poor management at the time. corruption too. should have been a golden age.. and now all we have is regrets.
@M_Tarar but that's the tragedy of 90s we threw away so much talent thinking there was so much coming & suddenly there was vacuum
@M_Tarar after 03 we didn't have any bower who had played even 30 tests, the ones we had we didn't pick or manage like Saqi or Azhar
@Shortpitched yeah Actor had a brain but just not disciplined enough. yup Saeed Ajmal is from the same school as Wasim and Saqlain.
@M_Tarar Wasim & Saqi are once in a generation bowler. We only have Ajmal since them, Shaibi was excellent in one series vs Eng in 05/06
@Shortpitched maybe. guess my fav bowlers have always been the smart ones like Wasim, Saqlain. ppl like Sami are the exact opposite of that.
@M_Tarar but that's about management. Imran jaws to tell Wasim everything after every ball. Thts what Oz's r doing with Johnson, Cummins etc
@Shortpitched I don't know man. Sami seems to have no game sense. you can help a bowler with a lot of things but if he has no sense, that's
@Shortpitched tough.
@M_Tarar that's the worst part of Pakistan cricket. They don't know how to help players out of a rut. Same with Sami,immense talent not used
@Shortpitched don't throw him to the dogs at the death.
@M_Tarar Wasim used Saqi the best. But he did become very reliant on Doosra rather than doing what he did in the 90s
@Shortpitched @Amermalik12 if he had fitness issues, should've been helped. he was a great bowler. so smart & canny. Wasim like canny
@M_Tarar @Amermalik12 Saqi was brilliant.Can't forget tour of India in 99.If Moin hasn't missed Sehwag in Multan he would have played longer
@M_Tarar @Shortpitched ..he was off to Canada for the Sahara cup, the rest of the side were also nearby..the cashier was a Pakistani..
@Shortpitched @M_Tarar He asked it straight I can't forget it..one minute we were taking the piss out out Ejaz and Waqar who were downstairs
@Shortpitched @M_Tarar next this guy decided to have a go.
@Amermalik12 u r kidding, right? He didn't just ask Saqi that question just as that\n@M_Tarar
@M_Tarar @Shortpitched ..we were eating when he came up to us..first complimented Saqi..then said why did you guys throw the final..
@Amermalik12 @Shortpitched that's plain rude.
@M_Tarar @Shortpitched ..Saqi was angry with emotion..said if he is guilty of any such crime..he will take his shoes off and beat himself..
@M_Tarar @Shortpitched ..over his head there and then, his parents and brothers were such lively people, they instilled him with very strong
@M_Tarar @Shortpitched Will do IA
@Amermalik12 @Shortpitched yeah he definitely was one of Wasim's favorites. either give him my regards pls. big, big fan of his from the 90s
@Amermalik12 @Shortpitched he was my fav bowler along with Wasim.
@Amermalik12 I remember watching Saqi's first series vs SL in 95. Comms kept calling it straighter one as u saw it go away @M_Tarar
@Shortpitched That's very kind..IA hopefully sometime, have close relatives there!
@Amermalik12 if you are ever in Toronto then please let me know. Would love to take you out and shoot some cricketing breeze
@Amermalik12 @Shortpitched btw I remember a Wasim interview where he said that you have to support youngsters.. said you don't send
@Amermalik12 @Shortpitched youngsters in pressure situations. the seniors have to step up. the host asked "but you used to bowl Saqlain at

@Shortpitched he's just a whiner man. just listen to his views now. always blaming other ppl. the thing I won't forget is how his pace would
@Shortpitched sure. always thought he should open in t20s. was the perfect format for him. but I've lost patience with him & his attitude.
@M_Tarar but then he was treated unfairly when his time arrived. Keeping him out of t20 is still ridiculous. He should b opening like Watson
@Shortpitched I really stopped liking him after 2003. I don't think he tried hard enough after 2003 with his bowling. really annoyed me.
@Shortpitched could've been great but had no hunger.
@M_Tarar yeah that was always funny how his game improved with Azhar. Just as Afridi performs brilliantly when he makes a comeback
@Shortpitched automatically go up by 5 mph when Azhar would be recalled in the mid-late 2000s. otherwise hover at 75 mph.
@M_Tarar he denies it. He says he was unfit.\nBut u r right he should have worked harder on his bowling which just went south
@Shortpitched working hard enough? how can a guy like that become a great allrounder? Wasim/Imran never shied from hard work @Amermalik12
@M_Tarar but that's to the credit of player not mgmt. it ruined his future. He should have been next great all rounder @Amermalik12
@Shortpitched @Amermalik12 in his defense, it worked out reasonably well in the 99 WC.
@M_Tarar @Amermalik12 Wasim also sent Razi at 3 keeping Inzi, MoYo& Ijaz down the order.
@Amermalik12 @Shortpitched the death". Wasim immediately cut him off and saiid that that was a different case because Saqlain was so special
@Amermalik12 @Shortpitched from the very start. great praise from one of the greatest of all time.
@M_Tarar @Shortpitched ..values, he told me he was picked on because he got on well with Wasim Akram.
@Amermalik12 @Shortpitched loved Saqi bhai so much. saw his whole career. watching him bowl w Wasim was such a privilege. great partnership
@Shortpitched @M_Tarar Saqi joined tableegh long after the enquiry.. 2004 roughly..he is open and honest, he's one of my closest friends
@Amermalik12 @M_Tarar quite possible. But I am suspicious of all who became Tableeghi soon after that enquiry. Speaks of repentance

@Amermalik12 @M_Tarar not just in Pak but around the world. Saqi has been to NZ, WI, Wasim in India, Mushy in Eng

@Amermalik12 @Shortpitched a cloud over them. esp Wasim who I maintain is the greatest player I have seen. he was a bowling god. but painful
@Amermalik12 @Shortpitched to see the other stuff associated with him. esp when I was a kid.

@Amermalik12 @M_Tarar NOTW did what it had done Ericsson etc but I am glad they were jailed. It needed to come out in the open like daylight

@Amermalik12 @Shortpitched "All I know is they never meant to get them jailed" very interesting..
@M_Tarar @Shortpitched he may well have been..but I've heard otherwise..we'll never know. All I know is they never meant to get them jailed
@Amermalik12 @Shortpitched I read this suggested somewhere or maybe I convinced myself of this but I think Aqib was the one who told NOTW

@Amermalik12 @Shortpitched with the PCB
